featured.text: The children were so _____ to see the clown appear on stage that they laughed, screamed, and clapped their hands happily.
The book is not only informative but also , making me laugh and feel relaxed while reading it.
No one deserves to be laughed at for their pronunciation.
In 1930 we laughed on average for 19 minutes each day, but by 1980 it (34) to six minutes.
Children, (35) , can see the funny side of things more often and may laugh up to 400 times a day.

other.text: Have a good laugh today--and feel better for it.

“I’m 15 minutes older than him, but now I’m younger because of my heart and I’m not going to respect him,” Alfred said with a grin, pointing to his brother while talking to a roomful of reporters, who laughed frequently at their jokes.

definition.zh_def: 發出笑聲，表達快樂或愉悅的情感。
definition.en_def: To make a sound of amusement or joy, often as a response to something funny.
definition.example: She couldn't help but laugh at the comedian's jokes.
